title: Binance Japan launches with 34 tokens, BNB debuts in the country - Forkast News
content:
Author profile

Zoltan is a writer at Forkast with a deep passion for storytelling and blockchain. Prior to joining the team, he worked as a marketing and content writer, focused on software and technology. Zoltan holds a master’s degree from the Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich and is interested in the future of global financial decentralization.

title: Bitcoin Dips Below $29K, BNB Slides After Report on DOJ's Binance Concerns - CoinDesk
content: "Clearly, there are fears over a liquidation cascade happening within the Ethereum DeFi ecosystem, Richard Mico, the U.S. CEO of payment-and-compliance infrastructure provider Banxa, wrote in an email to CoinDesk. "I don’t know how likely such a cascade is, but the market seems jittery as a result of these metastasizing issues. What’s ironic is that DeFi had held up so well during the blowups of 2022, and yet it’s an exploit more recently that might be the trigger for a DeFi blowup itself now."

title: Binance Coin (BNB) Price Eyes 10% Jump Amid Bullish Pattern Formation - CoinGape
content:
The Binance coin price in four-time frame charts shows a bullish upswing under the influence of a rising channel pattern. For nearly two months, the coin price has been wobbling between the two parallel walking trendlines acting as dynamic resistance and support. The BNB price close to the bottom trendline shows a sign of a bullish reversal and potential for a sharp rally.

Also Read: BNB Price Trade Idea As Binance Bags Dubai’s Major Exchange License

advertisement

Binance Price Daily Chart

A bullish crossover between the 20 and 100 EMA should lure more buyers into the market.

A bullish pattern sets the BNB price for a 10% upswing

The intraday trading volume in the BNB coin is $596.5 Million, indicating a 17.5% loss

Source- Tradingview

Amid the recent uncertainty in the crypto market, the BNB price showed a sideways action limited between the range of $245 to $234. This two weeks consolidation showed the formation of a bullish reversal pattern called inverted head and shoulder. With an intraday game of 1.62%, the altcoin price gave a bullish breakout from the pattern’s neckline resistance.

By the press time, the Binance coin trades at $244 and tries to sustain above the breached trendline. If the buyers manage to hold this flipped support, the altcoin could prolong the recovery by 10% and reach the overhead trendline of the channel pattern.

Until the two trendlines remain intact, the Binance coin may linger in a sideways or slightly ascending trend.

Is BNB Price Still Under Correction Threat?

A look at the daily time frame chart shows the channel pattern is part of an inverted flag. This chart pattern is known to extend the downward trend upon the breakdown of its supported line. This crackdown will intensify the selling momentum and may plunge Binance coin to $220, followed by $200.

Exponential Moving Average: with the recent breakout, the BNB price also reclaimed a 200-day EMA obtaining an extra boost for the long traders.

Relatives strength index: the daily RSI slope above 60% strong bullish momentum in action

title: Earn Sei (SEI) Tokens on Binance by Staking BNB, TUSD, and FDUSD - CoinCodex
content:
The Binance cryptocurrency exchange has announced that Sei (SEI) will be the 36th project featured on its Launchpool platform. This means that eligible users (KYC is required) will be able to earn SEI tokens by staking BNB, TUSD, and/or FDUSD tokens.

The SEI farming period will begin on August 2, 2023, at 00:00 UTC and will last for a period of 30 days. The farming period will end on August 31 at 23:59 UTC. Sei will be listed on Binance on August 15 in trading pairs with BTC, USDT, and BNB.

Farm SEI Tokens on Binance

Binance plans to distribute 300 million SEI tokens through the Launchpool program. This allocation corresponds to 3% of the SEI token supply (10 billion tokens).

240 million SEI tokens will be distributed to BNB stakers, 45,000,000 will go to TUSD stakers, and the remaining 15,000,000 will go to FDUSD stakers. The amount of SEI each user will receive will depend on two factors: the size of their stake in proportion to the size of the respective staking pool, as well as the staking duration.

In addition to revealing the SEI farming program on its Launchpool platform, Binance has also announced that it will list the SEI token in trading pairs against Bitcoin, USDT, and BNB. The exchange shared the announcement on X (formerly Twitter) as well.

It is worth noting that Sei is not the only Launchpool project Binance announced today. The exchange has started a 30-day-long Launchpool campaign for CyberConnect (CYBER) as well.

What is Sei (SEI)?

Sei is a Layer 1 blockchain designed for the efficient trading of digital assets, operating as an open-source, versatile platform. The native utility token, SEI, serves various purposes, including paying for network fees, staking for providing network security, participating in governance, and acting as collateral for applications on the Sei blockchain.

The protocol's key components ensure high performance and user-friendly experiences. Twin-Turbo Consensus achieves rapid 400ms finality, outpacing other high-performance blockchains like Solana. Intelligent block propagation and optimistic block processing enhance response times. Single-slot finality and parallelization guarantee reorg resistance and lower transaction costs, respectively. Front-running prevention and native price oracles contribute to a more reliable trading environment.

Sei enables permissionless smart contracts deployment in Rust. The project has raised $35 million from three equity investment rounds, with 2 billion SEI tokens allocated to equity investors. As of August 1st, 2023, the total SEI supply is 10 billion, with 18% reserved for the token’s circulating supply upon listing.

How to farm SEI tokens on Binance?

If you want to farm Sei tokens, you’ll need to register an exchange account on Binance.

Create Binance Account

Please keep in mind that only users who complete an identity verification process with Binance are eligible to participate in Sei token farming on the Binance Launchpool platform.

Once your account is ready, you’ll need some BNB, TUSD, and/or FDUSD tokens to participate. If you already own these tokens, you can deposit some to your Binance account. Otherwise, Binance offers different methods of buying these tokens with either crypto or fiat.

After your account is verified and you have access to some BNB, TUSD, and/or FDUSD, navigate to the menu on the top side of the Binance interface and select "Earn". Then, go to "Launchpad".

Then, scroll down to the "Launchpool" section, and you’ll be able to find the available SEI farming pools. Depending on which tokens you want to stake, select the TUSD Pool, FDUSD Pool, or BNB Pool. Then, follow the instructions provided by the exchange. The following screenshot shows pools from a previous Launchpool project, as the pools for Sei are not available yet.

BNB price jumps after the Launchpool announcements

Following the Launchpool announcements for Sei and CyberConnect, the price of BNB, Binance’s native crypto asset, grew from $239.1 to $245.7, a price increase of nearly +3% in the span of just a few hours.

title: Earn CyberConnect (CYBER) Tokens on Binance by Staking BNB, TUSD, and FDUSD - CoinCodex
content:
The Binance cryptocurrency exchange has announced that CyberConnect (CYBER) will be the next project featured on its Launchpool platform. This means that eligible users (KYC is required) will be able to earn CYBER tokens by staking BNB, TUSD, and/or FDUSD tokens.

The CYBER farming period will begin on August 2, 2023, at 00:00 UTC and will last for a period of 30 days. The farming period will end on August 31 at 23:59 UTC. CyberConnect will be listed on Binance on August 15 in trading pairs with BTC, USDT, and BNB.

Farm CYBER Tokens on Binance

Binance plans to distribute 3 million CYBER tokens through the Launchpool program. This allocation corresponds to 3% of the CYBER token supply (100 million tokens).

2.4 million CYBER tokens will be distributed to BNB stakers, 450,000 will go to TUSD stakers, and the remaining 150,000 to FDUSD stakers. The amount of CYBER each user will receive will depend on two factors: the size of their stake in proportion to the size of the respective staking pool, as well as the staking duration.

In addition to revealing the CYBER farming program on its Launchpool platform, Binance has also announced that it will list the CYBER token in trading pairs against Bitcoin, USDT, and BNB. The exchange shared the announcement on X (formerly Twitter) as well.

Binance Launchpool is a great way to farm new tokens while taking on minimal risk. This is because users can choose to unstake their tokens at any time with no strings attached. However, keep in mind that the duration of the staking period determines the amount of tokens a user participating in a Launchpool program ultimately receives.

It is worth noting that CyberConnect is not the only Launchpool project Binance announced today. The exchange has started a 30-day long Sei (SEI) Launchpool campaign as well.

What is CyberConnect (CYBER)?

CyberConnect is a web3 social network that empowers developers to create social applications, giving users full control over their digital identity, content, connections, and interactions. CyberConnect seeks to challenge the profit-driven approach of traditional social media platforms by establishing a community-owned social network. It introduces the CYBER token for governance, voting on protocol improvements, and as a means of payment for CyberID and gas fees.

The platform comprises several essential components, including CyberAccount, a gasless user onboarding system; CyberGraph, a censorship-resistant contract for content and connections; and CyberNetwork, an efficient and scalable layer 2 network. With $25 million raised from private token sales and an additional $5.4 million from a public sale, the total CYBER token supply is 100 million, with approximately 11.04% expected to be in circulation upon listing.

According to the team behind the project, CyberConnect aims to usher in the next era of hyper scalability for web3 social dApps while providing users with a familiar web2 social networking experience. It seeks to break free from centralized tech and offer users true ownership and control over their digital lives.

How to farm CYBER tokens on Binance?

If you want to farm CyberConnect tokens, the first thing you’ll need is a Binance account.

Create Binance Account

Please keep in mind that only users who complete an identity verification process with Binance are eligible to participate in CyberConnect token farming on Binance Launchpool.

Once your account is ready, you’ll need some BNB, TUSD or FDUSD tokens to stake. If you already own these tokens, you can deposit some to your Binance account. Otherwise, Binance offers plenty of ways of buying these tokens with either crypto or fiat.

After your account is verified and loaded up with some BNB, TUSD, and/or FDUSD, head over to the menu on the top side of the Binance interface and select "Earn". Then, go to "Launchpad".

Then, scroll down to the "Launchpool" section, and you’ll be able to find the available CYBER farming pools. Depending on which tokens you want to stake, select the TUSD Pool, FDUSD Pool, or BNB Pool. Then, follow the instructions provided by the exchange. The following screenshot shows pools from a previous Launchpool project, as the pools for Sei are not available yet.

BNB price jumps after the Launchpool announcements

Following the Launchpool announcements for CyberConnect and Sei, the price of BNB, the native digital asset of the Binance ecosystem, surged from $239.1 to $245.7, a price increase of nearly +3%.
